name: nzbget
description: NZBGet is a Usenet downloader optimized for performance and low resource usage. It supports automation scripts, web UI, scheduling, and multi-threading with a lightweight daemon for self-hosting.
features: Usenet downloading: Efficient binary file downloading from Usenet newsgroups using NZB files.
Multi-threading: Parallel connections maximize download speed and bandwidth utilization.
Web interface: Manage downloads, view queue, and configure settings through browser UI.
Post-processing: Automatically unpack, verify, and organize downloads with custom scripts.
RSS feeds: Subscribe to feeds for automatic downloading of new releases.
Scheduling: Set download speed limits and schedules to manage bandwidth usage.
Priority queue: Organize downloads by priority with pause, resume, and reorder capabilities.
Duplicate detection: Avoid downloading the same content multiple times with smart checking.
Repair and verification: Automatic PAR2 verification and repair of damaged downloads.
Extension scripts: Customize behavior with Python or shell scripts for specialized workflows.
Low resource usage: Optimized C++ code runs efficiently on low-power devices like NAS.
API access: Integrate with Sonarr, Radarr, and other automation tools via JSON-RPC API.
